intro: Meadia dentata, commonly known as the toothed meadia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically white or pink, clustered in small inflorescences, and bloom during the warmer months. Meadia dentata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and stream banks.
